name: Harvard Food Finder
description:
An automated website that uses machine learning to find free food opportunities on campus, then extracts the event details and posts them online. It originated as a CS50 final project, but my partner and I continued working on it afterwards.

I implemented the Bayesian classifier that I trained to detect emails sent over Harvard mailing lists that mentioned free food, inspired by Bayesian spam filters. In addition, I designed the web app portion of the project.

Food Finder was featured in the Harvard Gazette. It was later one of the 15 projects accepted into HackHarvard Hack Week 2013 out of a pool of about 50 projects.
